info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A thunderstorm with heavy rainfall will impact portions of eastern Schenectady, eastern Albany, southeastern Saratoga and northwestern Rensselaer Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1010 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Delmar, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Scotia, Mechanicville, Delmar, Latham, Guilderland, Niskayuna, Menands, Ravena, Voorheesville and Green Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 9 and 25. Interstate 890 between exits 4b and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 21A and 7, and between exits 8A and 12. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
